description: Sen. Bob Casey is locked in a tight race with Dave McCormick in Pennsylvania. There will be an automatic recount of the votes, state officials say.
title: Recount triggered in Pa. Senate race as McCormick heads to D.C.

description: Illnesses linked to slivered onions on McDonald's Quarter Pounder burgers expand to 14 states, federal officials say.
title: McDonald's E. coli outbreak has sickened more than 100 people

description: Concerns about 23andMe's business prospects is raising questions about the genetic testing company's customer data.
title: 23andMe customer? What to know about the privacy of your genetic data.

description: Nearly 4 in 10 seniors have gotten vaccinated for COVID so far this year.
title: Many more seniors are getting COVID shots this year, CDC reports

description: Several of President-elect Donald Trump's Cabinet picks have generated controversy. CBS News political director Fin Gómez examines who could face the most trouble in the confirmation process.
title: Which of Trump's Cabinet picks could face most trouble getting confirmed?

description: KFC takes smaller competitor to court over wording rather than ingredients in touting its chicken.
title: KFC sues Church's Texas Chicken over "original recipe" ad claims

description: if a rise in inflation becomes a trend it could affect the Federal Reserve's quest to reach its target rates and keep the economy healthy. CBS News' Kelly O'Grady has more on the new data.
title: What to know about inflation as data shows slight rise

description: Trump will nominate Florida Rep. Matt Gaetz to serve as attorney general, according to a social media post.
title: Trump to nominate Matt Gaetz for attorney general

description: President-elect Donald Trump's transition team has announced his pick for attorney general: Republican Rep. Matt Gaetz of Florida. In a statement, the Trump team said Gaetz is "a champion for the constitution and the rule of law." CBS News political reporter Olivia Rinaldi has more.
title: Trump to nominate Rep. Matt Gaetz as attorney general

description: Tulsi Gabbard represented Hawaii in the U.S. House from 2013 to 2021.
title: Trump taps former Rep. Tulsi Gabbard for director of national intelligence

description: Millions of Americans could lose enhanced subsidies that currently help with the cost of health insurance purchased through the Affordable Care Act's marketplaces, according to experts. CBS MoneyWatch reporter Megan Cerullo has more.
title: Why millions of Americans could lose health insurance subsidies

description: The Federal Aviation Administration temporarily banned U.S.-Haiti flights for 30 days after planes coming from Florida and New York were struck by gunfire in Port-au-Prince. Christopher Hernandez-Roy, the deputy director and senior fellow of the Americas Program at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins CBS News with more on Haiti's violence.
title: FAA bans U.S.-Haiti flights over gang violence, gunfire hitting planes

description: President Biden is meeting Wednesday with the families of American hostages held in Gaza.
title: Biden meeting with families of American hostages held by Hamas

description: More news is emerging about President-elect Donald Trump's team picks as he visits with politicians in Washington. Zeke Miller, the chief White House correspondent for the Associated Press, joins CBS News with more on Trump's transition.
title: Breaking down Trump's trip to D.C. as more team picks emerge

description: South Dakota Sen. John Thune addressed reporters on Capitol Hill after being elected to replace Kentucky Sen. Mitch McConnell as Senate majority leader. David Yaffe-Bellany, a crypto and technology reporter at The New York Times, joins CBS News as more details emerge of new leadership in Congress.
title: John Thune on winning Senate majority leader election

description: Spanish police arrested Oscar Sanchez Gil along with 15 other people as part of a probe into the country's largest-ever cocaine bust.
title: Spain arrests top police officer after over $21 million found in home

description: The price of gold was on a record run ... until this month. Here's what to know (and what to do) right now.
title: How far has gold's price dropped in November?

description: The FBI is reportedly investigating burglaries at the homes of Kansas City Chiefs stars Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce. The string of burglaries happened early last month while neither of them were home. At least $20,000 in cash was taken from Kelce's home. Neither one has addressed the burglaries publicly.
title: Travis Kelce's and Patrick Mahomes' homes were broken into just days apart

description: Elon Musk will have to balance the many business dealings he has with the U.S. government as he contemplates joining President-elect Donald Trump for his second term in office. David Yaffe-Bellany, a crypto and technology reporter at The New York Times, joins CBS News with more on Trump's plan to create a temporary agency known as the Department of Government Efficiency that Musk may help lead.
title: Why does Musk want to join Trump during second term as president?

description: Elon Musk joined Donald Trump in Washington, D.C., for meetings with Republicans in Congress before the president-elect's transition meeting with President Biden. Musk and Trump's bond remains as questions emerge about how he can serve the administration. Gregory Korte, a White House and politics correspondent at Bloomberg, joins CBS News with more.
title: Musk joins Trump in D.C. for meetings

description: The last day of the 2024 Atlantic Hurricane Season​ is Nov. 30, but as we near that finishing line, the Caribbean has other thoughts in mind.
title: Next tropical weather threat could form in Caribbean this week

description: A $10,000 HELOC comes with inexpensive monthly payments that could fall further in the months ahead.
title: How much does a $10,000 HELOC cost monthly now that rates are falling?

description: Why do we cry? There's actually some good reasons for it — and an explanation for why shedding some tears can make us feel better.
title: Why do we cry? An expert explains the science behind it.

description: One couple took out a loan to cover the out-of-network costs of an abortion and drove eight hours to a hospital in the neighboring state.
title: Women suing over Idaho abortion ban said they felt like "medical refugees"

description: U.S. Army Air Forces Pvt. 1st Class Bernard J. Calvi, 23, died in a prisoner of war camp in the Philippines during World War II.
title: Remains of U.S. WWII airman identified after dying as prisoner of war

description: Republicans will have the majority in the House of Representatives, CBS News projects. This comes after the GOP gained control of the Senate and as President-elect Donald Trump prepares for his second term in office. CBS News' Nikole Killion reports.
title: Republicans will control House of Representatives, CBS News projects

description: Patrick Mahomes called the break-in "frustrating" and "disappointing," and said the investigation is ongoing.
title: Travis Kelce and Patrick Mahomes' homes were broken into just days apart

description: New data shows inflation rose slightly as the Federal Reserve navigates interest rate cuts following signs of cooling prices and a weaker labor market. CBS News contributor JD Durkin has more.
title: Inflation rises slightly as economy reacts to interest rate cuts

description: With inflation on the rise again, savers may have a small window of opportunity to lock in a high CD rate again.
title: Why you should open a CD now that inflation is rising again

description: The "Queen of Hallmark Christmas" Lacey Chabert joins "CBS Mornings Plus" to discuss her new holiday film "Hot Frosty" and "The Christmas Quest," which is her 15th Hallmark Christmas film.
title: Lacey Chabert on new holiday films

description: The total amount of credit card debt nationwide just keeps climbing. Here's how to get rid of your card debt now.
title: Credit card debt just hit a new high. Here's how to tackle yours now.

description: The Guardian says benefits of being on Elon Musk's social media platform X are outweighed by its "often disturbing content."
title: The Guardian to stop posting on X, calling it "a toxic media platform"

description: President-elect Donald Trump met with President Biden at the White House after gathering with House Republicans in Washington, D.C. Semafor's Kadia Goba joins CBS News with more on Trump's visit and the latest leadership news on Capitol Hill.
title: Latest news on Trump's D.C. visit with Biden, Republicans in Congress

description: Sen. John Thune of South Dakota is set to lead the Senate as majority leader in the new Congress, after Republicans flipped the chamber in the 2024 elections.
title: What to know about Sen. John Thune, the new Republican leader in the Senate

description: Donald Trump's plans for Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy's roles in his government are emerging after he announced they would head a temporary agency known as the Department of Government Efficiency. CBS News' Libby Cathey breaks down what's known.
title: Behind Trump's plans for Elon Musk, Vivek Ramaswamy

description: The Petersen Automotive Museum hosts a collection of more than 400 classics, including Hollywood legend Steve McQueen's 1956 Jaguar, now worth more than $30 million.
title: Jay Leno's look inside one of the top car collection museums in the U.S.

description: President Biden welcomed President-elect Donald Trump back to the White House during a meeting to ensure a smooth transition before the January inauguration. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more.
title: How Trump and Biden's meeting started at the White House

description: Cruising through Los Angeles in an open-top sports car epitomizes the California dream. That's why LA naturally became home to one of the world's finest car collections, the Petersen Automotive Museum, now marking its 30th anniversary. For car enthusiast Jay Leno, it's a beloved destination.
title: Jay Leno's rides through 30 years of auto history

description: After his ALS diagnosis, Zac Brown Band's John Driskell Hopkins plans to donate $3 million to fund research through his "Hop On A Cure" foundation and released a new single titled "Each Other."
title: John Driskell Hopkins on new song and $3 million donation for ALS research

description: South Dakota Sen. John Thune has been elected to replace Kentucky Sen. Mitch McConnell as the upper chamber's Republican leader. CBS News' Nikole Killion reports.
title: John Thune elected Senate Republican leader as Mitch McConnell steps down

description: A 35-page list outlines the hundreds of books removed from library shelves in Florida's 73 school districts.
title: Hundreds of books pulled from Florida school libraries

description: President-elect Donald Trump arrives in Washington; John Krasinki named People's "Sexiest Man Alive."
title: Nov 13: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET

description: Senior administration officials expect it will be the last in-person meeting between the two leaders of Biden's presidency.
title: Biden and Xi to meet in Peru this weekend

description: Inflation ticked back up again in October, which could impact your credit card interest rates. Here's how.
title: Will credit card interest rates increase now that inflation is climbing?

description: Amazon rolls out a new shopping service, dubbed Amazon Haul, that sells items for $20 or less.
title: Amazon debuts Amazon Haul with "crazy low prices." Here's what to know.

description: A U.S. government employee has been arrested and is facing charges over an online leak of classified documents about Israel's potential plans for a retaliatory strike against Iran. CBS News senior national security correspondent Charlie D'Agata has more on that and President-elect Trump's pick for secretary of defense.
title: Man arrested over leak of records about Israeli plan for retaliatory strike against Iran

description: Spirit Airlines, weighed down by mounting debt, is considering filing for bankruptcy protection.
title: Spirit Airlines mulls bankruptcy, sending its stock price into nosedive

description: President-elect Donald Trump and President Biden met Wednesday at the White House for the first time since Trump's win in the election. Norah O'Donnell anchored CBS News' special report on the meeting.
title: Trump and Biden meet at White House | Special Report

description: "The Russian captain's legs were blown off and he died of blood loss," a Ukrainian security official told the AFP news agency about the assassination.
title: Ukraine says Russian naval commander killed with car bomb in Crimea

description: Special Counsel Jack Smith, who led two federal cases against President-elect Donald Trump, is wrapping up his work and planning to resign before Trump takes office in January. CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson has more on the ramifications of that.
title: Cases against Trump will wind down as Jack Smith plans resignation

description: Archaeologists thought they had found one grave, but excavation efforts turned up a treasure trove of ancient tools and coins.
title: Archaeologists find ancient treasures near grave of WWII soldier

description: Who are the high rollers who bankrolled Trump's 2024 election, and what do they want in return for their generosity?
title: The megadonors who fueled Trump's election and what's behind their giving

description: Faulty transmission control valve can fail and cause rear wheels to lock up, increasing risk of crash, according to General Motors.
title: GM recalls nearly 500,000 pickup trucks and SUVs. Here's what to know.

description: President-elect Donald Trump is set to meet President Biden at the White House on Wednesday. CBS News political reporter Libby Cathey reports on what could take place at their meeting.
title: What to expect from Trump meeting with Biden

description: Vanity Fair's Hollywood issue celebrates nearly 30 years of spotlighting actors shaping the industry. This year's cover stars include veteran icons like Nicole Kidman and Zoe Saldana, and recent breakout stars like Glen Powell and Sydney Sweeney among the 12 honorees. Editor-in-chief Radhika Jones has more.
title: Vanity Fair's Hollywood Issue cover stars revealed

description: U.S. inflation rose 2.6% on an annual basis in October, matching forecasts from economists, but signaling a bumpy road ahead in the Federal Reserve's battle to tame inflation. CBS News MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady has more.
title: Inflation rises 2.6% in October after Fed starts interest rate cuts

description: Two more monkeys that escaped a South Carolina research facility last week have been trapped and returned, the facility's CEO said.
title: More escaped monkeys captured as lawmaker slams lab's negligence

description: "Mean Girls" star Lacey Chabert and "Schitt's Creek" alum Dustin Milligan kick off the holiday season with Netflix's "Hot Frosty." They join '"CBS Mornings" to discuss their magical new romantic comedy.
title: Lacey Chabert and Dustin Milligan on teaming up for "Hot Frosty"

description: President-elect Trump announced Tuesday that his new agency known as the Department of Government Efficiency will be run by billionaire Elon Musk and former GOP presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy. It's still unclear how the department will work. CBS News political reporter Libby Cathey has more.
title: Trump gives Musk and Ramaswamy roles leading "Department of Government Efficiency"

description: Are you considering a home equity line of credit right now? Here's how it could save you money.
title: 4 ways a HELOC could save you money right now

description: Elon Musk will be traveling on President-elect Donald Trump's plane, a source said.
title: Trump and Biden to meet at White House today

description: As "Anchorman" celebrates 20 years, "Mornings Memory" look back to 2013 when Nancy Cordes visited the Newseum's exhibit honoring the one and only Ron Burgundy.
title: "Mornings Memory:" Celebrating 20 years of "Anchorman"

description: Diagnosed with ALS in 2021, John Driskell Hopkins and his wife started the "Hop On A Cure" foundation to raise awareness and funds. This year, they will donate $3 million for grants and research. He joins "CBS Mornings" to talk about his mission.
title: Zac Brown Band's John Driskell Hopkins on fighting ALS through music

description: President-elect Donald Trump met with House Republicans in Washington on Wednesday before heading over to the White House to meet with President Biden. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more on the day ahead for Trump.
title: Trump meets with House Republicans before meeting with Biden

description: The 65-year-old actor and stand-up comedian, best known for portraying Joey Gladstone on "Full House," said he first noticed symptoms in October.
title: "Full House" star Dave Coulier announces cancer diagnosis

description: As winter approaches, it's the perfect season to dive into a new book. Amazon Books Editorial Director Sarah Gelman joins "CBS Mornings" with the top picks for 2024.
title: Amazon's top book picks of 2024 revealed

description: From sadness to joy, our emotions can bring on tears. Dr. Gail Saltz explains the science behind our tears and what causes us to cry.
title: Why we cry when we're sad, happy or stressed

description: More communities across the U.S. are voting to remove fluoride from water, with Lebanon, Oregon, being the latest location to take action. As Robert F. Kennedy Jr. raises concerns over fluoride's safety,  Dr. Aaron Yancoskie of Touro College of Dental Medicine joins "CBS Mornings Plus" to look at the debate.
title: Communities debate on removing fluoride from its water supplies

description: President-elect Trump is pushing to end diversity training in the military and has pledged to fire generals he believes support a "woke" agenda. A new board of retired military officials could help identify leaders deemed unfit. Vivian Salama, the national politics reporter with The Wall Street Journal who helped break this story, has more.
title: Report: Trump may create "warrior board" to remove "woke" military leaders

description: A government employee faces charges over an online leak of classified national defense information.
title: U.S. government employee charged in leak of Israel's plans to attack Iran

description: Inflation ticked back up to 2.6% in October. Here's what that rise could mean for mortgage rates.
title: Inflation's up again. Here's what it could mean for mortgage interest rates.

description: President-elect Donald Trump is in Washington Wednesday for the first time since winning the election. He'll meet with Republican congressional leaders on Capitol Hill and President Biden at the White House. CBS News campaign reporter Libby Cathey has the latest.
title: Trump arrives in Washington D.C. ahead of meeting with Biden, GOP leadership

description: When a mother of two is found dead in her home, her father obtains death scene photos that help solve the case. "48 Hours" contributor David Begnaud reports Saturday, Nov. 16 at 9/8c on CBS and streaming on Paramount+.
title: Sneak peek: The Suspicious Death of Megan Parra

description: Democrat Ruben Gallego beat Trump ally and Republican Kari Lake in Arizona's Senate race. He drew suport from Hispanic men, a group that drifted toward President-elect Donald Trump in Arizona and nationwide during this election. Gallego spoke with Ed O'Keefe about immigration, Trump and what the Democratic party needs to do going forward.
title: Arizona Senator-elect Ruben Gallego on future of Democratic party

description: On Wednesday, President Biden will host President-elect Donald Trump in the Oval Office as Trump continues to build his administration. Trump says billionaires Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy will head a new agency to cut what he sees as waste in the federal government. He also announced he is nominating Pete Hegseth to serve as defense secretary. The Fox News host and Army veteran has blasted diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives in the military.
title: Biden to host Trump at White House as he builds his administration, Cabinet

description: President-elect Donald Trump has repeatedly said he plans to fire special counsel Jack Smith.
title: Jack Smith plans to leave Justice Department by the time Trump takes office

description: Climbing gold prices may signal deeper worries about inflation. Here's what to consider now.
title: How gold prices reflect inflation expectations

description: The Biden administration says "some progress" by Israel to address civilian suffering in Gaza is enough to keep American weapons flowing.
title: U.S. to keep arming Israel as U.N. calls Gaza "unfit for human survival"

description: One of the world's most prominent religious leaders has resigned after not reporting cases of suspected child abuse to police. Justin Welby, the Archbishop of Canterbury, is the top official in the worldwide Anglican Communion, which includes the Episcopal Church here in the U.S.
title: Top official in Anglican Communion resigns over handling of child abuse

description: The DNA testing company 23andMe is facing serious financial concerns and has announced major restructuring. CBS News MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady explains what happens to the private consumer data the company has collected if it decides to sell that information.
title: What to know about 23andMe private data collected amid company's financial issues

description: GOP senators will elect a new leader to succeed Sen. Mitch McConnell after he announced earlier this year that he would step down from leadership. There's an intense three-way battle to replace him between senators Rick Scott, John Cornyn and John Thune.
title: Three Republicans vie for top Senate spot as GOP looks to elect new majority leader

description: CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Bob Costa explains what to know about President-elect Donald Trump's nominations for his Cabinet and other administration roles.
title: What to know about Trump's latest Cabinet picks

description: Michael Scott Moore was kidnapped in Somalia in 2012 and held hostage for nearly three years.
title: 2 Somali pirates get 30 years for kidnapping U.S. journalist

description: President-elect Donald Trump announces new administration roles, including one for Elon Musk and another for a Fox News host and veteran. Also, multiple wildfires continue to burn around the Northeast, with help from high winds and unusually dry conditions. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: President-elect Donald Trump announces new administration roles

description: CBS News foreign correspondent Ramy Inocencio has been speaking to experts in Hong Kong about how China is preparing for the incoming Trump administration and the tariffs on Chinese goods that the president-elect has promised.
title: What the new Trump presidency could mean for U.S.-China relations

description: At least two people have died and several others are injured after a massive explosion at a Louisville food coloring factory Tuesday. The cause of the blast is still under investigation.
title: At least 2 killed in explosion at Louisville plant

description: U.S. forces conducted a second straight day of strikes over Syria Tuesday, hitting targets linked to Iranian-aligned militia groups in response to recent attacks on U.S. personnel, according to U.S. Central Command. Meanwhile, the 30-day deadline the U.S. set for Israel to increase humanitarian assistance in Gaza has passed with the U.N. saying the level of aid is nowhere near the level required to support residents there. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Elizabeth Palmer has more.
title: More U.S. strikes in Syria, U.S. deadline for Israel to boost aid in Gaza passes

description: The Federal Reserve began cutting its benchmark rate in September amid cooling inflation.
title: U.S. inflation rose 2.6% in October, a month after Fed's first rate cut

description: Republicans on Wednesday will choose between South Dakota Sen. John Thune, Texas Sen. John Cornyn and Florida Sen. Rick Scott to replace outgoing GOP Senate Leader Mitch McConnell. At this point, President-elect Donald Trump hasn't lent his support to any of the three, but Scott is positioning himself as the MAGA candidate. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has more.
title: Republicans to vote on Senate leader with Thune, Cornyn and Scott the frontrunners

description: Special Counsel Jack Smith, the leader of two federal prosecutions of Donald Trump, will wrap up his work and resign before the president-elect takes office in January, according to new reporting from the New York Times.
title: Special Counsel Jack Smith to resign before Trump takes office, New York Times reports

description: President-elect Donald Trump managed to surprise some Republicans on Capitol Hill with his choice for secretary of defense, going with Fox News host and veteran Pete Hegseth. CBS News political director Fin Gómez has more on who Hegseth is and the new White House roles Trump has selected Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy for.
title: Trump picks Fox News host and veteran Pete Hegseth for defense secretary

description: Trump tapped Vance as his running mate in July, prompting him to depart from the Senate to serve as vice president following the election. Here's how the process works.
title: What happens to Senate, Congressional seats for those joining the Trump administration

description: Germán Reyes was arrested on charges of homicide for the killing of Alejandro Arcos just a week after he took office as mayor, officials said.
title: Former prosecutor is arrested in beheading of mayor in Mexico

description: The U.S. says there will be a "firm response" as Ukrainian forces holding ground in Russia's Kursk region now face North Korean troops "engaging in combat."
title: Russia attacks Kyiv as North Korean troops enter fight against Ukraine

description: The babies - one born on Feb. 14 and the other on Feb. 15, 1965 - are now 59-year-old women and they are filing a lawsuit.
title: Women switched at birth in 1965: "They kept it secret"

description: Control of the House has yet to be determined, but Republicans are operating as if they've secured the majority.
title: House GOP moves ahead with leadership elections as majority yet to be decided

description: Whip John Thune​ of South Dakota, former Whip John Cornyn​ of Texas and Sen. Rick Scott​ of Florida are in the race for Senate Republican leader.
title: Senate Republicans to elect new leader as Trump looms over contest

description: Fernando Valenzuela, the beloved Los Angeles Dodgers pitching ace who helped the team win the 1981 World Series, died of septic shock last month, according to his death certificate.
title: Fernando Valenzuela died from septic shock, medical examiner says

description: U.S. airlines are barred from flying to Haiti for a month after 3 American carriers' planes are hit by gunfire amid relentless gang violence in the Caribbean nation.
title: U.S. halts flights to Haiti after 3 planes hit by gunfire

description: President-elect Donald Trump has called the Biden administration's student loan relief efforts a "total catastrophe."
title: Here's what to know about Trump and the future of student loan relief
